title.narrative: Resilience Support the Holy Rosary Women’s Cooperative

description.narrative: CAFOD supported the Missionary Sisters from 2014 – 2016 in the construction and development of a Cassava Processing Factory in Kpatema Village, Bo District. Since the factory’s inception, it has been maintained and utilised by women’s groups largely associated with the Catholic Women’s Association in Bo. However, over the course of the past three years the factory has faced challenges in terms of sustainability and business development. The factory has now been taken over by a cooperative group of ten women who have committed themselves and their own funds to the development of a cassava processing business. They have been trained in the production of high quality gari and have already formed linkages with the local market. However, the factory is in a transitional period. CAFOD has agreed to support the current leadership in the rejuvenation of the factory in a hope that consistent production will re-start. To this end, the cooperative will be supported with inputs, repairs and maintenance for machines and support in shortening the cassava value chain through the procurement of a mobile grater and processing machine. CAFOD will also support in the training and development of business management skills amongst the cooperative women and help them to produce a comprehensive business plan.
